question: 近々
sourceMnemonic:
When something is <kanji>close</kanji> <kanji>close</kanji> (the <ja>々</ja> character repeats the kanji that was before it) it will happen <vocabulary>in the near future</vocabulary>, or <vocabulary>soon</vocabulary>. 

This is pretty vague, and it's up to the person speaking to decide how soon <vocabulary>soon</vocabulary> is. Depending on the person and the situation, it could technically be used for anything up to a few years!
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading is the kun'yomi reading twice; that's the one you learn with the vocab word <ja>近い</ja> from the previous level. The second <ja>近</ja> gets converted to <ja>ぢか</ja>, though, so take note of that.
